skill.name: executing-plans
skill.description: Use when you have a written implementation plan to execute in a separate session with review checkpoints
skill.summary: Use when you have a written implementation plan to execute in a separate session with review checkpo...
skill.author: obra

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and guidelines for executing implementation plans. The static analysis flag for 'weak cryptographic algorithm' is a false positive - line 3 contains only a YAML description field, not cryptographic code. No security risks identified.

content.value_statement: Stop struggling with complex multi-step implementations. This skill breaks development plans into manageable batches with review checkpoints, ensuring quality and catching issues early.
actual_capabilities: Loads and critically reviews implementation plans before execution
Executes tasks in configurable batches (default: 3 tasks)
Provides detailed progress reports between batches
Integrates with TodoWrite for task tracking
Requires explicit skill references for sub-tasks
limitations: Requires a pre-written implementation plan file
Stops execution on any blocker - requires human intervention
Cannot proceed without explicit verification steps

use_cases.title: Implement Complex Features Safely
use_cases.description: Break down large features into planned steps with quality checkpoints between implementation batches.

use_cases.title: Standardize Implementation Process
use_cases.description: Ensure consistent execution of technical plans with built-in review cycles and verification steps.

use_cases.title: Learn Structured Development
use_cases.description: Follow proven patterns for implementing complex tasks with proper verification and feedback loops.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Plan Execution
prompt_templates.scenario: You have a simple implementation plan
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a plan file called 'feature-plan.md'. Please use the executing-plans skill to implement it step by step.

prompt_templates.title: Large Feature Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute the plan in 'auth-system-plan.md' but be extra careful with the database migration steps. Check with me after each batch.

prompt_templates.title: Team Collaboration
prompt_templates.scenario: Implementing plans written by team members
prompt_templates.prompt: Review and execute the plan in 'api-redesign.md'. I wrote it based on our architecture discussion - flag any issues you see.

prompt_templates.title: Custom Batch Size
prompt_templates.prompt: Load the plan from 'microservice-plan.md' and execute only 2 tasks per batch. This is critical infrastructure, so go slow.

output: First batch: Completed tasks 1-3 (database schema, API endpoints, tests)
Verification: All tests passing, schema migration successful
Plan review: Found unclear error handling in step 7
Clarified with team: Use custom exceptions for payment failures
Executing batch 1: Payment gateway setup and configuration
Completed with verification: Gateway connection test passed

best_practices: Always review the entire plan critically before starting execution
Stop immediately when hitting blockers rather than making assumptions
Run all verification steps exactly as specified in the plan
Report progress clearly between batches for stakeholder review
anti_patterns: Do not skip the initial plan review step - critical issues may be missed
Never guess or improvise when instructions are unclear - always ask
Do not proceed to next batch without explicit feedback or approval

faq.question: What happens if I hit a blocker during execution?
faq.answer: Stop immediately and ask for clarification. Do not guess or work around the issue.

faq.question: Can I change the batch size?
faq.answer: Yes, the default is 3 tasks but you can specify any number based on complexity and risk.

faq.question: Do I need to use TodoWrite?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill automatically creates and manages tasks using TodoWrite for proper tracking.

faq.question: What if the plan has fundamental flaws?
faq.answer: Raise concerns during the initial review step before any execution begins.

faq.question: How do I handle verification failures?
faq.answer: Stop the batch, report the failure, and wait for guidance before proceeding.

faq.question: Can I execute plans out of order?
faq.answer: No, follow the plan sequence exactly as written to maintain dependencies.
